Name: Salty Dog
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
4 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Fizz or Highball (8oz to 10oz) glass .
RIM glass with salt (moisten outside edge with grapefruit juice and dip into salt).
Prepare garnish of grapefruit slice wheel.
Review: Whether enjoyed with breakfast or as an evening aperitivo, this is a superbly cleansing and refreshing cocktail. Our previous recipe called for 50ml vodka, 15ml maraschino and 50ml grapefruit juice. I like maraschino, but, as many pointed out, it's not traditionally an ingredient in this vintage cocktail.
History: A cocktail from the late 1950s/early 1960s, its first appearance in a recipe book is in Ted Saucier's 1962 Bottom's Up: New and Revised Edition .
Nutrition: One serving of Salty Dog contains 147 calories
